arts.ttl: James Wilson reveals Hearts v Rangers favour for teacher he jokes will help schoolboy wonder make the grade
arts.sum: Jambos prodigy is living the dream at Tynecastle but the reality iof school exams is also just round the corner.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough defensive injury update as Michael Carrick reveals pride in Luke Ayling
arts.sum: Saying the veteran defender made him feel proud, Ayling was forced to come on as a left-sided centre-back early in the second half of the much-needed Stoke City victory as George Edmundson picked up an ankle injury. Edmundson himself was in the team because Rav van den Berg missed out through injury, with Dael Fry now Boro ’s only senior fit centre-back.

arts.ttl: 'Fuming' Mark Robins demands Stoke City players show some bottle
arts.sum: We've got 12 games left and we have to pick up enough points to stay in the division and we've got to win some tackles. Robins knows there are lots of things to fix in the long-term but the only focus now is winning enough tackles to give themselves a chance of winning games and staying in the Championship.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's half-time frustrations that sparked Middlesbrough's important Stoke City win
arts.sum: I didn't like the last bit before half-time which ended up with the goal. Boro ended a five-game losing run as second-half goals from Finn Azaz and Tommy Conway sealed a massive three points to move Boro within four points of the top six again.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Middlesbrough as furious home crowd lets rip
arts.sum: Stoke were not at the races even before Marcus Forss opened the scoring with a left-foot rasper and Tommy Conway missed an open goal. But Stoke got their pressing wrong all the way through from front to back and the visitors advanced unchallenged for Forss to glide past Enda Stevens to drift in from the right and crash a shot past Johansson in the 20th minute.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough ease pressure on boss Michael Carrick with victory at Stoke
arts.sum: Finn Azaz and Tommy Conway scored second-half goals to help Boro to a 3-1 win.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Middlesbrough as key man starts for first time in two months
arts.sum: Manhoef, Ben Wilmot and Nathan Lowe are called into the Stoke side that lost at Norwich on Saturday, with Junior Tchamadeu and Ben Pearson taking places on the bench. Manhoef has come off the bench in the last two games and this is his first start since mid-December.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs Middlesbrough live - Team news from the bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Robins said: “I think from a physical perspective he’s a really, really strong, powerful player that has still got to learn how to use his strength and power to get the maximum benefit for himself and for us. Sam Gallagher is back after a month-and-a-half out with a hamstring problem, making a sub appearance at Norwich for the first time since Robins’ first game in charge back on January 4.

arts.ttl: Steven Schumacher hails ‘really good’ Bolton Wanderers characteristic despite regular uphill battles
arts.sum: Bolton Wanderers manager Steven Schumacher trusts his players to carry on coming from behind to win games this… The post Steven Schumacher hails ‘really good’ Bolton Wanderers characteristic despite regular uphill battles appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Stoke City v Middlesbrough: How to watch, live stream, TV channel, kick-off time
arts.sum: Stoke fans will tell you that a trip to the bet365 Stadium is the ideal cure for the malaise Boro are suffering right now, but they will also know that back-to-back home games - Watford are in the Potteries on Saturday - offer their own team a way clear of the drop zone. Stoke City will be looking to claim back-to-back home wins for the first time this season when they host Michael Carrick's Middlesbrough in the Championship on Tuesday.
